page.title: 18HALLATON: TORCH HOUSE 2
page.content: Much of the printing, taping, collat- ing and library work takes place in the old coach houses and air-raid shelters. Most of the time there are 40-50 people living in Torch House and the three new houses built in the grounds. About half the staff are vis- ually handicapped. Some of the Torch folk are involved with the village chapel and many staff and helpers, blind and sighted, are well known to villagers as they use the village shop and travel on the bus. Villagers are invited to Torch for the open day, the Easter Sunday Praise Service, and the Christmas Carol Service. Many visit Torch at other times as the doctor holds his surgery there twice a week. The main surgery is at Kibworth, 8 miles away, so this local surgery is much appreciated. Mothers and babies meet the health visitor there also.
